dict.string: Short Codes (3$)
%SCinternational

Dear _____,


Thank you for your e-mail. Great questions! Short codes are provisioned on a country-by-country basis. A short code is only able to send messages to, and receive messages from, same-country phone numbers on carrier networks that have approved the short code.


US/ Canada short codes can only send to US/ Canada phone numbers on US/ Canada carrier networks that have approved that short code. If the end user is on a supported US/ Canada carrier network but is out of the country, the message may be delivered successfully, but delivery is not guaranteed.

Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Codes - No International Support

Dear _____,
Thank you for your e-mail. Great questions! Short codes are provisioned on a country-by-country basis. A short code is only able to send messages to, and receive messages from, same-country phone numbers on carrier networks that have approved the short code.
US/ Canada short codes can only send to US/ Canada phone numbers on US/ Canada carrier networks that have approved that short code. If the end user is on a supported US/ Canada carrier network but is out of the country, the message may be delivered successfully, but delivery is not guaranteed.
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

%SCMsgs

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!


Twilio phone numbers are not able to receive SMS messages from short codes. Short code carriers have agreements to exchange messages with mobile carriers, but not with VoIP carriers, which is the category of carriers to which Twilio phone numbers belong.


I am sorry that we cannot accommodate your use case. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Codes - Twilio Number Cannot Receive Messages from SCs

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!
Twilio phone numbers are not able to receive SMS messages from short codes. Short code carriers have agreements to exchange messages with mobile carriers, but not with VoIP carriers, which is the category of carriers to which Twilio phone numbers belong.
I am sorry that we cannot accommodate your use case. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
%SCtransfer

Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Yes this is possible, you can "migrate" your short code that you have with another provider into Twilio. For more information regarding how to do this, please visit the page below for more information:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223182268-Applying-to-migrate-your-short-code-to-Twilio


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Code - Transfer SCs from another Provider to Twilio

Dear ______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
Yes this is possible, you can "migrate" your short code that you have with another provider into Twilio. For more information regarding how to do this, please visit the page below for more information:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223182268-Applying-to-migrate-your-short-code-to-Twilio
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
%SCConfig

Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I hope today finds you well. To configure the Message Request URL for your short code, please go to the Short Code page below in your Twilio account portal. However, it appears that your short code is still under review from ______. Once your review is fully completed by all carriers, your short code will be clickable and you will be able to configure your Message Request URL through the link below:


https://www.twilio.com/user/account/phone-numbers/shortcode


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Codes - Configure Message Request URL for SCs

Dear ______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I hope today finds you well. To configure the Message Request URL for your short code, please go to the Short Code page below in your Twilio account portal. However, it appears that your short code is still under review from ______. Once your review is fully completed by all carriers, your short code will be clickable and you will be able to configure your Message Request URL through the link below:
https://www.twilio.com/user/account/phone-numbers/shortcode
I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
%SCNoSupport

FOR METRO PCS:


Dear Ashley,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that you are unable to deliver messages to ______.


For US operator MetroPCS, the error may mean the end user is not provisioned to receive SMS from all short codes or specific short codes. Additionally, MetroPCS does not deliver short code SMS to any of its resellers' numbers. You will receive this error if you attempt to send a short code message to a MetroPCS reseller number. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting their cellular service providers. Another reasonable course of action would be to retry using a US long code instead of your short code and see if messages are delivered successfully.


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

—


FOR T-MOBILE AND SPRINT:


Dear _______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that _______ .


May I ask do you know if ____ has short code support as part of their mobile plan? To provide some background information, a common reason why short codes messages are not being delivered to the mobile carriers is that your end-users' mobile plans do not support short code messaging. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting their cellular service providers. I will recommend checking with your end users to see if they are able to receive short code messages at all (Twilio short codes and other short codes as well).


If your end users report that their mobile plans do indeed support short code messaging, may you please provide 3 or more [Message SID}(https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/what-is-an-sms-message-sid) examples from the past 24 hours that where your end users did not receive your short code messages? I will like to further investigate.


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,



—


RECOMMEND SHORT CODE REROUTE:


Hello ______,


This is Josephine from Twilio Support Team here to help out Stephanie with this ticket. I am sorry to hear that some of your users are unable to receive messages from your short code 34816.


Thank you for providing the Message SIDs, I appreciate it. It looks like from the Message SIDs, the users are all using T-Mobile. Non-delivery to these numbers is very likely because these users do not have short code support as part of their mobile plan. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting T-Mobile.


Please note that when using Messaging Services Shortcode Reroute, Twilio will automatically deliver the message with a long code in your Messaging Service **only** if a carrier is not supported by a Twilio short code. Please note that Twilio fully supports T-Mobile, however, Twilio is unable to detect whether an end user does not have short code as part of their mobile plan as this varies by each individual and what their plan supports.


More information below:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#shortcode-reroute


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/short-codes/what-carriers-are-supported-on-twilio-short-codes


Another alternative, I will recommend using our Lookups service to determine the carrier of the end users' number and then implement a logic to send over a long code if messages have "undelivered/failed" statuses.


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/lookups


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Short Codes - US carriers such as Sprint and T-mobile No Support for SCs

FOR METRO PCS:
Dear Ashley,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that you are unable to deliver messages to ______.
For US operator MetroPCS, the error may mean the end user is not provisioned to receive SMS from all short codes or specific short codes. Additionally, MetroPCS does not deliver short code SMS to any of its resellers' numbers. You will receive this error if you attempt to send a short code message to a MetroPCS reseller number. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting their cellular service providers. Another reasonable course of action would be to retry using a US long code instead of your short code and see if messages are delivered successfully.
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
—
FOR T-MOBILE AND SPRINT:
Dear _______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that _______ .
May I ask do you know if ____ has short code support as part of their mobile plan? To provide some background information, a common reason why short codes messages are not being delivered to the mobile carriers is that your end-users' mobile plans do not support short code messaging. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting their cellular service providers. I will recommend checking with your end users to see if they are able to receive short code messages at all (Twilio short codes and other short codes as well).
If your end users report that their mobile plans do indeed support short code messaging, may you please provide 3 or more [Message SID}(https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/what-is-an-sms-message-sid) examples from the past 24 hours that where your end users did not receive your short code messages? I will like to further investigate.
I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

RECOMMEND SHORT CODE REROUTE:
Hello ______,
This is Josephine from Twilio Support Team here to help out Stephanie with this ticket. I am sorry to hear that some of your users are unable to receive messages from your short code 34816.
Thank you for providing the Message SIDs, I appreciate it. It looks like from the Message SIDs, the users are all using T-Mobile. Non-delivery to these numbers is very likely because these users do not have short code support as part of their mobile plan. Individual users can attempt to remedy this by contacting T-Mobile.
Please note that when using Messaging Services Shortcode Reroute, Twilio will automatically deliver the message with a long code in your Messaging Service **only** if a carrier is not supported by a Twilio short code. Please note that Twilio fully supports T-Mobile, however, Twilio is unable to detect whether an end user does not have short code as part of their mobile plan as this varies by each individual and what their plan supports.
More information below:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#shortcode-reroute
https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/short-codes/what-carriers-are-supported-on-twilio-short-codes
Another alternative, I will recommend using our Lookups service to determine the carrier of the end users' number and then implement a logic to send over a long code if messages have "undelivered/failed" statuses.
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/lookups
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
%SCStopFiltering

OPTION 1:



Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Unlike with a long code, Twilio does not handle your short code’s HELP & STOP replies, or your opt-out list by default. You should build this functionality into your own short code messaging application. For information on carriers’ requirements for short code HELP and STOP replies, please see this article below:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/short-codes/what-are-the-requirements-for-short-code-help-and-stop-messages


With some exceptions, Twilio can handle your short code’s HELP & STOP replies and opt-out list by request. For more details, please contact your account manager.


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


——


OPTION 2:



Hello ______,


Great questions! To answer your questions below:


(1) I have attached the how-to guide below for your review. Please note you will need to build out this opt-out process for your short code. Examples are also included in the guide.


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/short-codes/what-are-the-requirements-for-short-code-help-and-stop-messages


The reason why Twilio does not support this opt-out process for short codes is because every short code's campaign is different and the opt-out process is usually more specific than for long codes.


(2) I have reached out to your Account Manager and he will be in touch with you shortly. If you are unsure of how to implement this with your short code, your Account Manager can help and answer any further questions you may have.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Short Code - STOP/HELP Filtering Build Yourself

(2) I have reached out to your Account Manager and he will be in touch with you shortly. If you are unsure of how to implement this with your short code, your Account Manager can help and answer any further questions you may have.
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
%SCNoMMS

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Please note that short codes do not have MMS capability by default. However, if you will like to add MMS support there is a one-time fee of $500 to enable this capability for your short code. If interested, please let me know and I will need to reach out to our Short Code Team to update your short code application.


I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Code - No MMS Support

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
Please note that short codes do not have MMS capability by default. However, if you will like to add MMS support there is a one-time fee of $500 to enable this capability for your short code. If interested, please let me know and I will need to reach out to our Short Code Team to update your short code application.
I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
%SCVirginIslands

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing issues sending and receiving messages from +1340 area codes. 


I further investigated into this area code +1340 and I see that this area code is towards Virgin Islands. Please note that Twilio US short codes do not support sending and receiving messages from Virgin Islands and outlying territories. 


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Short Codes - Cannot Deliver to Virgin Islands

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing issues sending and receiving messages from +1340 area codes.
I further investigated into this area code +1340 and I see that this area code is towards Virgin Islands. Please note that Twilio US short codes do not support sending and receiving messages from Virgin Islands and outlying territories.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
%SCFTEU

GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT FTEU SHORT CODES:


I checked with our Carrier Relations Team and there's a possibility that your previous short code 23177 is a Free to End Users (FTEU) short code. Subscribers on T-mobile that have short code messaging plan disabled, they may still get messages from short codes that are Free to End Users (FTEU). FTEU short codes are a special kind of short codes where the costs of messages are collected on the sending party and hence it is completely free of charge for end users/recipients. 60680 is not a FTEU short code, hence if short code support is disabled for your T-Mobile end users, messages will not be delivered.


Below are the T-Mobile plans that do not support short codes:


T-Mobile Simple Choice Plan with No Credit Check does not support short codes

T-Mobile Business lines are set up to not support short codes by default (the business must request this feature)
Short Code - FTEU Short Codes (T-Mobile Plan Information)

GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT FTEU SHORT CODES:
I checked with our Carrier Relations Team and there's a possibility that your previous short code 23177 is a Free to End Users (FTEU) short code. Subscribers on T-mobile that have short code messaging plan disabled, they may still get messages from short codes that are Free to End Users (FTEU). FTEU short codes are a special kind of short codes where the costs of messages are collected on the sending party and hence it is completely free of charge for end users/recipients. 60680 is not a FTEU short code, hence if short code support is disabled for your T-Mobile end users, messages will not be delivered.
Below are the T-Mobile plans that do not support short codes:
T-Mobile Simple Choice Plan with No Credit Check does not support short codes T-Mobile Business lines are set up to not support short codes by default (the business must request this feature)
